pageContext.claim: “And I will say this, if the wrong person came into this office, you wouldn’t only be even and you wouldn’t be up — I think it’s now 42.5 percent, and the markets up again, but 42.5 percent since election — you would be down 30 to 40 percent.”
pageContext.analysis: Given the stock market climbed substantially during Obama's administration, there is little reason to believe the market would have fallen so dramatically under Hillary Clinton. A president, especially initially in a presidential term, has relatively little impact on business decisions.
